sv.purpose: Att vid föreliggande metabol acidos beräkna förväntad respiratorisk kompensation baserat på aktuellt bikarbonatvärde.
sv.use:
Använd vid föreliggande metabol acidos alternativt blandad acidos för att beräkna respiratorisk kompensation. 

Formeln baseras på aktuellt bikarbonatvärde angivet i mmol/l, och genererar ett intervall +/- 2 om värdet som beräknats.

Förväntat PaCO2 (kPa) = 1.5*HCO3 + 8 +/- 2.
Beräkningen görs baserat på värde angivet i mmHg och behöver således konverteras till kPa, vilket enklast görs genom att multiplicera resultatet med 0.133322 (1).

en.purpose: Winters' Formula for Metabolic Acidosis Compensation helps to calculate the expected respiratory compensation needed for a purely metabolic acidosis.
keywords: Winter's formula for Metabolic Acidosis Compensation
en.use:
With a patient with a suspected pure metabolic acidosis and a patient with a mixed acidosis to determine the level of compensation.

The formula uses a bicarbonate value in mmol/L and provides a range that is +/- 2 either side of the calculated value.

Expected PaCO2 in kPa = 1.5*HCO3 + 8 +/- 2 [This calculation applies in mmHg and so needs to be converted to kPa after calculation which can be done by multiplying the result by 0.133322] (1)

There is a 1mEq/l drop in Hco3 to each 1mmHg drop in PaCo2  (2)
en.misuse: Do not use to diagnose but to calculate the respiratory compensation as provided by receiving an accurate bicarbonate value.

other_details.references:
Ref. 1: Adrogué, H.J. (2006). Metabolic acidosis: pathophysiology, diagnosis and management. Journal of nephrology, 19 Suppl 9, S62-9.

Ref. 2: Albert MS, Dell RB, Winters RW. Quantitative Displacement of Acid-Base Equilibrium in Metabolic Acidosis. Ann Intern Med. 1967;66:312-322. doi:10.7326/0003-4819-66-2-312.

then: $gt0009|Expected PaCO2 compensation top end of range|.precision=2
$gt0010|Expected PaCO2 compensation bottom end of range|.precision=2

gt0009.text: Expected PaCO2 compensation top end of range
gt0009.description: Calculated from the bicarbonate value as: Expected PaCO2 in kPa = 1.5*HCO3 + 8 + 2 (1)

gt0010.text: Expected PaCO2 compensation bottom end of range
gt0010.description: Calculated from the bicarbonate value as: Expected PaCO2 in kPa = 1.5*HCO3 + 8 - 2 (1)
